simple.name: device_kind
simple.description: This specifies the device kind

simple.name: device_model
simple.description: This specifies the specific device

structsequence.name: frontend_tuner_status
structsequence.description: Status of each tuner, including entries for both allocated and un-allocated tuners. Each entry represents a single tuner.

simple.name: allocation_id_csv
simple.description: Comma separated list of current Allocation IDs.

simple.name: antenna
simple.description: Current antenna this tuner is configured to use.

simple.name: available_bandwidth
simple.description: Available bandwidth (Hz) in range (XX-YY) or csv (X,Y,Z) format. Do not put units in field.

simple.name: available_frequency
simple.description: Available frequencies (Hz) in range (XX-YY) or csv (X,Y,Z) format. Do not put units in field.

simple.name: available_gain
simple.description: Available gain (dB) in range (XX-YY) or csv (X,Y,Z) format. Do not put units in field.

simple.name: available_sample_rate
simple.description: Available sample_rate (sps) in range (XX-YY) or csv (X,Y,Z) format. Do not put units in field.

simplesequence.name: available_antennas
simplesequence.description: List of antennas available to this tuner.

simple.name: bandwidth
simple.description: Current bandwidth in Hz

simple.name: bandwidth_tolerance
simple.description: Allowable percentage over requested bandwidth. This value is provided by the requester during allocation.

simple.name: center_frequency
simple.description: Current center frequency in Hz.

simple.name: complex
simple.description: Indicates if the output data is complex.

simple.name: enabled
simple.description: Indicates if tuner is enabled, in reference to the output state of the tuner.

simple.name: gain
simple.description: Current gain in dB.

simple.name: group_id
simple.description: Unique ID that specifies a group of Device.

simple.name: output_format
simple.description: Indicates the SDDS digraph that describes the current output data format.

simple.name: output_multicast
simple.description: Multicast address for SDDS output.

simple.name: output_port
simple.description: Port number for SDDS output.

simple.name: output_vlan
simple.description: VLAN number for SDDS output. A value of zero (0) indicates no VLAN is used.

simple.name: reference_source
simple.description: Indicates internal (0) vs external (1) reference source.

simple.name: rf_flow_id
simple.description: Specifies a certain RF flow to allocate against.

simple.name: sample_rate
simple.description: Current sample rate in samples per second.

simple.name: sample_rate_tolerance
simple.description: Allowable percentage over requested sample rate. This value is provided by the requester during allocation.

simple.name: stream_id
simple.description: Stream ID associated with tuner/allocation

simple.name: tuner_index
simple.description: Index of tuner. This ID can uniquely indentify a tuner, unlike tuner_number, which is not necessarily unique among all tuners.

simple.name: tuner_number
simple.description: Physical tuner ID.

simple.name: tuner_type
simple.description: Example Tuner Types: TX, RX, CHANNELIZER, DDC, RX_DIGITIZER, RX_DIGTIZIER_CHANNELIZER

simple.name: valid
simple.description: Indicates if the tuner is in a valid state. For DDCs, false indicates the attached CHANNELIZER has moved such that the DDC can no longer tune to the appropriate frequency.

simple.name: device_group_id_global
simple.description: Any allocations requested on this device must have a matching group_id field (ie - the group_id value defined in the allocation structure must match the group_id for the device). These values default to an empty string and therefore match by default. Please see the Frontend Interfaces v2.0 documentation for a full description.

simple.name: device_rx_gain_global
simple.description: Global RX_DIGITIZER gain value

simple.name: device_tx_gain_global
simple.description: Global TX gain value

structsequence.name: sdds_network_settings
structsequence.description: Settings for the network connection(s). Leave empty to disable SDDS output. A single entry will be used for all RX_DIGITIZERs, with the ip_address being incremented for each RX_DIGITIZER beyond the first. Otherwise, include an entry for each RX_DIGITIZER. If there is more than one entry, but less than the number of RX_DIGITIZERs, RX_DIGITIZERs without settings will have SDDS output disabled.

simple.name: interface
simple.description: The network interface you intend to be present or blank if no check is needed. Do not include the VLAN in the interface name. (eg. For eth0.28 the interface should be set to "eth0" NOT "eth0.28").

simple.name: ip_address
simple.description: For the unicast case this is the destination IP address to send the UDP packets. For the multicast case this is the multicast group. If there is only a single network settings struct entry, the IP address specified will be used for the first RX_DIGITIZER, and then be incremented for each additional RX_DIGITIZER. Leave blank (empty string) to disable SDDS output for the RX_DIGITIZER.

simple.name: port
simple.description: UDP port used to publish data.

simple.name: vlan
simple.description: Virtual Lan address to use. Ignored if set to 0.

simple.name: attach_user_id
simple.description: Used as a parameter to the attach call.

simple.name: downstream_give_sri_priority
simple.description: Informs downstream components, via the BULKIO_SRI_PRIORITY keyword, to override the xdelta and real/complex mode found in the SDDS Packet header in place of the xdelta and mode found in the supplied SRI.

simple.name: sdds_endian_representation
simple.description: The endianness (Big or Little) of the data portion of the SDDS packet. Defaults to Network Byte Order (Big Endian). Native will use the endiance of the host. This will also affect the SRI keyword DATA_REF_STR and set it appropriately.

simple.name: ttv_override
simple.description:
Specify how to derive the TTV value, which is used in the SDDS header and in the attach call. Default behavior is to derive from BulkIO metadata.
Time Tag Valid (ttv) field denotes if the values stored within the Time Tag information fields (Time Tag, Time Tag Extension) are valid. Unless overridden, this is derived from the tcstatus field of BulkIO Timestamps and is set to true if equal to TCS_VALID and false otherwise.

simple.name: buffer_size
simple.description: Size of SDDS port's internal buffer, specified in terms of how many maximum-capacity BulkIO packets it can hold. The USRP sizes the BulkIO packets to about 90% of the max CORBA transfer size, which is typically specified in /etc/omniORB.cfg on the host system, and is typically on the order of 2 MBs.

struct.name: target_device
struct.description: Information used to specify a particular USRP device to target. All fields are optional. First device found that meets the specified criteria is selected.

simple.name: ip_address
simple.description: IP address of the USRP for network connected devices.

simple.name: name
simple.description: Name of the USRP device

simple.name: serial
simple.description: Serial number of the USRP device

simple.name: update_available_devices
simple.description: When set to true, the available_usrp_devices property will be updated with all available usrps found on the network. Similar output to the uhd_find_devices command

structsequence.name: available_devices
structsequence.description: Lists all USRPS found on the network (updated by setting update_available_devices property to true)

structsequence.name: device_channels
structsequence.description: Describes the daughtercards and channels found in the USRP

simple.name: chan_num
simple.description: This is the per tuner type channel number. This means that there could be a tuner 0 for an RX and a tuner 0 for a TX.

simplesequence.name: available_antennas
simplesequence.description: List of antennas available for this channel.

struct.name: device_antenna_mapping
struct.description: Mapping of RFInfo ports to physical RF connectors (antenna names).

simple.name: RFInfo_in
simple.description: Name of USRP antenna associated with RFInfo_in port. This antenna will be on RF-A.

simple.name: RFInfo_in2
simple.description: Name of USRP antenna associated with RFInfo_in2 port. This antenna will be on RF-A.

simple.name: RFInfo_in3
simple.description: Name of USRP antenna associated with RFInfo_in3 port. This antenna will be on RF-B.

simple.name: RFInfo_in4
simple.description: Name of USRP antenna associated with RFInfo_in4 port. This antenna will be on RF-B.

simple.name: RFInfoTX_out
simple.description: Name of USRP antenna associated with RFInfoTX_out port. This antenna will be on RF-A.

simple.name: RFInfoTX_out2
simple.description: Name of USRP antenna associated with RFInfoTX_out2 port. This antenna will be on RF-B.

struct.name: configure_tuner_antenna
struct.description: Configure a tuner to use a specific antenna. Invalid values are ignored (either invalid tuner_id or invalid antenna for that tuner_id).

simple.name: tuner_index
simple.description: `tuner_index` of tuner being configured as specified in the `frontend_tuner_status`.

simple.name: antenna
simple.description: Name of antenna.

struct.name: frontend_tuner_allocation
struct.description: Frontend Interfaces v2.0 main allocation structure

simple.name: tuner_type
simple.description: Example Tuner Types: TX, RX, CHANNELIZER, DDC, RX_DIGITIZER, RX_DIGTIZIER_CHANNELIZER

simple.name: allocation_id
simple.description: The allocation_id set by the caller. Used by the caller to reference the device uniquely

simple.name: center_frequency
simple.description: Requested center frequency.

simple.name: bandwidth
simple.description: Requested Bandwidth

simple.name: bandwidth_tolerance
simple.description: Allowable Percent above requested bandwidth (ie - 100 would be up to twice)

simple.name: sample_rate
simple.description: Requested sample rate. This can be ignored for such devices as analog tuners

simple.name: sample_rate_tolerance
simple.description: Allowable Percent above requested sample rate (ie - 100 would be up to twice)

simple.name: device_control
simple.description: True: Has control over the device to make changes False: Does not need control and can just attach to any currently tasked device that satisfies the parameters (essentually a listener)

simple.name: group_id
simple.description: Unique identifier that specifies a group of device. Must match group_id on the device

simple.name: rf_flow_id
simple.description: Optional. Specifies a certain RF flow to allocate against. If left empty, it will match all frontend devices.

struct.name: frontend_listener_allocation
struct.description: Allocates a listener (subscriber) based off a previous allocation
